Two Diagrams

Diagram 1, Interactive

The diagram depicts a list of policies and gives a brief description of each.

Identification and Authentication Policies
Specifies authorized persons that can have access to network resources and verification procedures.
This includes physical access to wiring closets and critical network resources such as servers, switches, routers, and access points.
Password Policies
Ensures passwords meet minimum requirements and are changed regularly.
Acceptable Use Policies
Identifies network applications and usages that are acceptable.
Remote Access Policies
Identifies how remote users can access a network and what is accessible via remote connectivity.
Network Maintenance Procedure
Specifies network device operating systems and end user application update procedures.
Incident Handling Procedures
Describes how security incidents will be handled.
